timeline.message: New UserServiceTestConfiguration: contains transitive @Imports for UserServiceImpl
New UserServiceTestConfiguration: contains transitive @Imports for UserServiceImpl

timeline.bodyText: 🤔 The problem we'll run into, though, is that Java uses single inheritance. So I can't use this same trick for the WorkspaceService or NotebookService if any tests for those also need the UserService
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: very true.  I really want this to be a Scala trait (mixin) but we don't have this.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: I vaguely recall it being possible to build a config class that you can @Import into another one, but it's 50/50 whether I made that up.
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText:
I vaguely recall it being possible to build a config class that you can @Import into another one, but it's 50/50 whether I made that up.

Definitely possible – see 
  
    
      workbench/api/src/integration/java/org/pmiops/workbench/BaseIntegrationTest.java
    
    
         Line 21
      in
      c44a41f
    
    
    
    

        
          
           @Import({IntegrationTestConfig.class})
replies.author: gjuggler

replies.bodyText: This is much better, thank you.  I'll update to this.
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.message: in soviet russia bean mocks you
